DOC.brief_summary: Objectives 1 . To characterize mechanical ventilation practice general anesthesia surgery 2 . To assess dependence intra-operative post-operative pulmonary complication intra-operative Mechanical Ventilation ( MV ) setting
DOC.brief_title: Local Assessment Ventilatory Management During General Anesthesia Surgery
DOC.detailed_description: Research question - What MV-settings use general anesthesia surgery ? - Do MV-settings vary and/or center ? - Do MV-settings vary internationally ? - Are MV-settings associated incidence intra-operative pulmonary complication ? - Are MV-settings associated incidence post-operative pulmonary complication ?

This include MV perform supraglottic device ( e.g . laryngeal mask ) This include patient receive MV onset procedure ( e.g . Intensive Care Unit patient ) This include patient receive onelung ventilation procedure Obstetric surgical procedure procedure pregnancy Surgical procedure outside operating room Surgical procedures involve extracorporal circulation
